Pneumonia or abnormalities in chest computed tomography images were detected in almost all hospitalized patients with COVID-19. The characteristic radiographic findings are ground glass opacities, which are typically bilateral and peripheral, coexisting with consolidations or cord-like opacities.
17, 27, 28 26 27 As COVID-19 progresses, “reverse halo” or “crazy-paving” radiologic patterns may become apparent. Notably, some radiologic features are rare with COVID-19, such as lymphadenopathy, nodules, pleural effusions, or cavitation, and would potentially suggest other pathologies.
